markdown:
<title level="1" right="Rules">[Swamp](/Rules.aspx?ID=2792)</title>

**Source** [GM Core](/Sources.aspx?ID=218) pg. 92 <sup>2.0</sup>

<row gap="medium">
<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">
Wetlands are the most common kind of swamp, but this category also includes drier marshes such as moors. Swamps often contain quicksand hazards (page 107). Despite their soggy nature, swamps aren’t very likely to experience heavy flooding, since they act as natural sponges and absorb a great deal of water before they flood.
</column>

<column gap="medium">

</column>

</row>

<document level="2" id="rules-2793" />

<document level="2" id="rules-2794" />

text: Swamp Source GM Core pg. 92 2.0 Wetlands are the most common kind of swamp, but this category also includes drier marshes such as moors. Swamps often contain quicksand hazards (page 107). Despite their soggy nature, swamps aren’t very likely to experience heavy flooding, since they act as natural sponges and absorb a great deal of water before they flood.
